learning_objective: Create procedures with parameters to organize code and make it easier to reuse.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex and their friends are brainstorming for a start-up. They quickly notice that the process of assessing the potential of a business idea is repetitive and could be automated. Alex thinks of a procedure in which an idea is input and the output indicates whether it is a good idea or not based on previous data. Which of the following code best represents this procedure?",
    "Answer1": "procedure evaluateBusinessIdea(number averageProfit, number startupCosts)if averageProfit > startupCostsreturn 'Good Idea'elsereturn 'Bad Idea'endend",
    "Answer2": "procedure evaluateBusinessIdea(data BusinessIdea)if BusinessIdea.averageProfit > BusinessIdea.startupCostsreturn 'Good Idea'elsereturn 'Bad Idea'endend",
    "Answer3": "procedure evaluateBusinessIdea(data BusinessIdea)boolean ideaValuationif BusinessIdea.averageProfit > BusinessIdea.startupCostsideaValuation = trueelsereturn ideaValuation = falseendreturn ideaValuationend",
    "Answer4": "procedure evaluateBusinessIdea()number averageProfit = getInput('Enter average profit: ')number startupCosts = getInput('Enter startup costs: ')if averageProfit > startupCostsreturn 'Good Idea'elsereturn 'Bad Idea'endend",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "The most efficient procedure to evaluate a business idea would use a Business Idea object as a parameter. This object could include all the necessary data fields like averageProfit, startupCosts, marketSize, etc., allowing the procedure to be easily reused for other ideas."
}
